author: kuni
title: Automated Multilingual Tool
description: Marketing in a world that aims for Web 3.0 relies on "manual-work and trust" and is not scalable.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal tries to create a mechanism to multilingualize the information transmitted by Cardano blockchain, and the information transmitted by the projects in its ecosystem, and deliver it to the local community in real time. The project will automate the creation of information pages by deploying them online, and the completion of delivery to each community activity space, such as Discord communities and Telegram. I found the ideas are very interesting and can bring value to the Cardano ecosystem. The team also provides potential risk as how to reach as many people as they can.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a roadmap and clear milestones for launch of protocol media, support local community, and promote content dissemination, among others. However, probably there are a minor typo of operation by the end of October 2020, which should be 2022. The team gives a detailed and broken down of how they will use the proposed budget (team operation, System, marketing PR, etc). The team also elaborates in great detail background and relevant experience on each people on the team and provide a LinkedIn profile for all member. The LinkedIn profile is very good to have since the community can easily verify they are giving funds to the legitimate team.
f6_assessments.q2: Metrics and KPIs for success are clearly defined by language covered, the number of projects, establish discord community, assigning community moderators for each local community, each point also have measurable items and thus can be objectively judged are successful or not.

f6_assessments.q0: The scope of the proposal is to build a mechanism that will automatically and in real time translate into multiple languages the information transmitted by the Cardano Blockchain and all projects in the ecosystem, without the need of human interference or any kind of manual work. This idea has a lot of potential, and would create a bigger sense of cohesion throughout the community, if anyone would be able to understand in real time what is happening throughout the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
While the key milestones are described and easy to understand, the plan for achieving the first and most important milestone, for which this proposal is requesting funding, that of launching the media infrastructure, is not described at all. The description doesn’t need to be very technical, yet the lack of any kind of information makes it hard to visualise what in would entail to develop it, and as such if it is feasible with the current plan, budget and team.
The budget otherwise is well divided and comprehensive, and the team description is accompanied by links to the team’s social profiles.
f6_assessments.q2:
The progress of the project is well described through the KPIs provided, and while they are detailed, there is no mention regarding the verification source of the successful implementation for each step (where can the community verify “languages coverage: English + Japanese (PoC: Chinese, Korean, French)” or see “Number of projects: ~20 projects” and who those projects are)
The success description is otherwise succinct, but sufficient.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal aim in  creating a mechanism to multilingualize the information transmitted by Cardano blockchain, and the one transmitted by the projects in its ecosystem, and deliver it to the local community in real time.
This will impactthe ecosystem as it'll facilitate the accessto that info, and facilitate community engagement. And on the other end, make work easy for content creators who would have another means to spreading the info.
The proposal focuses on English, French, Japanese, Korean and Chinese. The number of languages may still be increased in number on a mid or long term period, which prove the scalability of this project.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is composed by people with various expertise and have been involved in the blockchain. Also, one their past proposal got funded and is currently underway.
Worldwide, the number of people speaking one or some of the targeted languages is this proposal is important and located in different geographic areas, which is a advantage for the Cardano community to penetrate, since it'll reach out to so many people and have them join.
Automation of spreading the community information within and outside of it is n=beneficial and that's the response suggested through this.
the budget is reasonable, even though is set in sections that are not detailed enough.
f6_assessments.q2:
Community may easily audit this project as all the work realized would be online and accessible by anyone within the community.
The challenge would reside in the competition (difference of choice) from voters amongst various proposals in different challenges this fund that are proposing the translation of the contents as their main activity.

f6_assessments.q0: With many project currently popping out within Cardano, this proposal will help with providing a multilingual tool as a service. Scalably, this proposal’s project, will help other project with its content delivery. This means that Scalably will provide translation into different languages using their automated tools, and this will help the non-english speaker to engage with the project. By that aspect, this proposal could help onboard more broad range of people who doesn’t speak english into the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: To get it out of the way first, I think there’s a typo within the schedule timeline “..of October 2020”, moving on. The team consist of people with relevant experience. Some of them have a long experience with blockchain technology. This proposal is by far have the most comprehensive team profile, explained well and in detail about their work record. The budget detail is provided, however it could be broken into more detail, for example: 6 months of operation by the team- explain what the team does, the deliveries within the operation, etc. (It could be the work hour for managing or handling team meeting, organizing event, etc.). About the implementation, I’m not really sure how they would implement this. It says “Automated Tool”, but I don’t see any explanation on how this would work, or the concept of it, other than “it will help project to focus on their project instead of content deliveries”. This proposal said that “The protocol works for your ecosystem delivering content to community spaces P2P in a borderless web3.0 community...”, is that mean that Scalably will make a decentralized “language translation” freelance as a service? But then they said that this protocol have collaboration with top language tech companies, without specifying which companies is it. Furthermore, this proposal didn’t explain their roadmap in detail, for example it could be better if they provide their milestones or goals for the 1st, 3rd, and 6th month. The lack of roadmap, technical detail on implementation, and budgeting is what keeping me from giving it a 4 or 5 star. The comprehensive team profile is what makes this project would actually deliver.
f6_assessments.q2: It would be helpful to include roadmap with timeline and goals within each time frame. The KPIs is included with target number and expectation, which is great and clear. For tracking the progress, they have a website that the community could track their update.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal's goal is to create an automated translation tool for the Cardano ecosystem to be able to get all Non-English speaking communities a chance to get information and also part-take in discussions. This will achieve the mission of this challenge setting and Cardano as a whole by sharing information to those who might not have access to it and also help solve the problems created by language barriers. Brilliant idea I must say.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal shares some relevant information needed to implement the project in detail, like the timeline, the budget plan for the project, and proof of experience of the team with their LinkedIn links. From the information put across the team has their research done on how to make this a success and I believe when funded, this project can be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics and the milestones of this proposal are clear and understandable. The team tells us what success looks like for this project and how they can achieve their goals. The proposal also shares with us how the community can follow the progress of this project making it easy to audit.
